Content.Title: Manuscript Collections
Content.BodyCopy:
Our Manuscript Collections pertain primarily to local history, the Upper Snake River Valley and surrounding area. These are organized into records groupings based primarily on creators of the material. These collections can be best used by first consulting the MSSI finding aids. Use the Search field above or click for a lisiting of the collections.

Click for a detailed description of our collecting policy.

Other areas that fall within this area include:

File Manuscripts: Small, file-sized collections grouped often by a creator or common topic.

Life Sketches: Short biographies of individuals in the local area used regularly in genealogical research.

Oral Histories: Interviews conducted to gather a person's personal story or experience with a certain subject. Large oral history projects have been conducted in the past and BYU-Idaho classes often perform similar work.

 Manuscripts
1. Click on the "Collections" link on the left side of the page.
2. Then click the type of material you are searching for.
3. You can then browse the manuscript database for the desired collection.

Manuscripts
The manuscript collections of the Brigham Young University-Idaho Special Collections are donated in part by patrons to form the hand written version of a book, article, document, or other work prepared by the author. They contain material of outstanding research importance for all periods, countries and disciplines. File Manuscripts and Life Sketches are both located here as well. We have also placed the Oral History Interviews in this category.

History of Idaho
This site takes you to the Idaho State Historical Societies website where you can find just about everything you need to know about Idaho.

Newspapers
This will give you a list of both the Campus Newspapers and the Local Newspapers. You can then click on the link to the newspaper you would like to search.

Newspapers
1. Use the link under "Collections" for the location of solid or digital copies of a school or local newspaper.

Books
The easiest way to search our Local History Book Collections is to search the Library Catalog. Through this link you can click the drop down menu labeled books then click advanced search. You can then type in the desired topic. On the right hand side there is a drop down menu that reads "Limit by", you can click on this and click "Special Collections", it is about 13 down the list and it will show you the books that we have here in Special Collections relating to that topic.

A few of the major local book collections we have include:

  • The Snake River Echoes
  • Upper Snake River Valley Idaho Histories

Photographs
There are a couple of local digital photograph collections:

  • Clark County Historical Photographs
  • Teton County Historical Photographs

Photographs
1. If the desired collection is already known, use the "Photograph" link under "Collections" on the left side of the page to find the appropriate photographer or subject collection.
2. If you would like to search all of the university digital online photographs, click on the "Digital Photograph" tab under "Collections" and enter a term in the search box. Click "Search."
3. Click on any title or thumbnail image to view the full description and a larger image. You may click on any of the linked text under the photograph image to search the collections for more photo descriptions containing those subject terms.

These images are low resolution digital copies provided for your reference. If you would like to order a higher resolution image file for personal use or publication, please contact the Special Collections reference desk at (208) 496-9540.
